answers.answer: I am going to be induced at 37 weeks
How lon until you are 37 weeks, and what's the reason for being induced?
Why are they doing it so early?
Well I have gestational diabetes, and I'm having to use insulin to control my blood sugar levels. There are a lot of complications that can come from having GD, so my doctor plans on inducing me

I was just induced on the 28th of November at exactly 37 weeks because my baby was IUGR and I was all ready 2 cm dilated and 70% effaced. when I was given the pitocin it took me 11 hours to get to 4 cm but got the epidural at 3 bc my contractions were becoming almost unbearable. by the time I was 4 cm it only took 2 hours to get to 10 cm and I could feel her head even with the epidural. I pushed for 7 minutes and she was out and the pushing wasn't painful at all. she was born 6 llbs 1 oz and 18 inches!
What is IUGR? Congratulations though!!! I'm assuming she is healthy, and there were no complications after birth?
Im being given a c section at 37 weeks due to my complications and them wanting bub out as he is doing well and they need to get my health sorted.

I am currently 24 weeks right now and because I had a stillbirth this past April my baby passed away when I was 6 months so I am again pregnant and the doctor is just being cautious he said it's better a little earlier just to be safe.. and I saw you have gestation diabetes What were your symptoms??
Honestly I didn't have any symptoms, other than being tired all the time. I didn't even know I had GD, and was extremely shocked when I found out I had it!

I'm sorry. But as long as youvtake care everything will be fine. I was asking because I don't know Why but I feel like when I take the test I'm not gonna pass and I'm going to have it. I just always feel so thirsty!  And I heard that when youvaleays feel thirsty it's because it's a symptom of diabates but I guess I'll be having the test next appointment.

OH! I forgot about that symptom. I was constantly thirsty before finding out. I wouldn't worry too much. Yours could be for a different reason. Being thirsty is part of pregnancy anyway. Good luck though!!!
IUGR - intrauterine growth restriction. it's basically when baby stops growing at a constant rate. and yes! she was a healthy 6.1 pounds :)

question: anyone out there that's has or is being induced at 37 weeks?
title: Induced at 37 weeks?
